title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1026.1 - Waiver of requirements
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1026.1 - Waiver of requirements

State Regulations

The chairman may, on a case-by-case basis, waive any of the
requirements set forth in Parts 1024 and 1025 of this Title, upon the written
application of any person, provided that such person demonstrates that the
issuance of such waiver would: (a) be
in the public interest; (b) promote
the safe and efficient flow of traffic and commerce; and
(c) preserve the health, safety and welfare
of other persons using the facilities of the authority, and the general public. The chairman may grant such waiver upon any terms and conditions he considers
appropriate for the proper regulation of the use of facilities of the
authority. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1026.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
